1:1: This is the account of what Nehemiah son of Hacaliah accomplished
In the month of Kislev in the twentieth year that Artaxerxes was emperor of Persia

1:2: arrived from Judah with another group
and I asked them about Jerusalem and about the other Jews who had returned from exile in Babylonia

1:3: They told me that those who had survived and were back in the homeland were in great difficulty and that the foreigners who lived nearby looked down on them
They also told me that the walls of Jerusalem were still broken down and that the gates had not been restored since the time they were burned

1:4: For several days I mourned and did not eat

1:5: and we stand in fear of you
You faithfully keep your covenant with those who love you and do what you command

1:6: as I pray day and night for your servants
My ancestors and I have sinned

1:7: We have acted wickedly against you and have not done what you commanded
We have not kept the laws which you gave us through Moses

1:8: Remember now what you told Moses
If you people of Israel are unfaithful to me
I will scatter you among the other nations

1:9: But then if you turn back to me and do what I have commanded you
I will bring you back to the place where I have chosen to be worshiped
even though you are scattered to the ends of the earth

1:10: You rescued them by your great power and strength

1:11: Listen now to my prayer and to the prayers of all your other servants who want to honor you
Give me success today and make the emperor merciful to me
In those days I was the emperor's wine steward

2:1: I took the wine to him
He had never seen me look sad before

2:2: Why are you looking so sad
so it must be that you're unhappy

2:3: How can I keep from looking sad when the city where my ancestors are buried is in ruins and its gates have been destroyed by fire

2:4: What is it that you want
I prayed to the God of Heaven

2:5: and then I said to the emperor
If Your Majesty is pleased with me and is willing to grant my request
let me go to the land of Judah
to the city where my ancestors are buried
so that I can rebuild the city

2:6: with the empress sitting at his side
He asked me how long I would be gone and when I would return

2:7: Then I asked him to grant me the favor of giving me letters to the governors of West-of-Euphrates Province
instructing them to let me travel to Judah

2:8: I asked also for a letter to Asaph
instructing him to supply me with timber for the gates of the fort that guards the Temple
and for the house I was to live in
The emperor gave me all I asked for

2:9: The emperor sent some army officers and a troop of cavalry with me
and I made the journey to West-of-Euphrates
There I gave the emperor's letters to the governors

2:10: from the town of Beth Horon
an official in the province of Ammon
heard that someone had come to work for the good of the people of Israel

2:12: I did not tell anyone what God had inspired me to do for Jerusalem
Then in the middle of the night I got up and went out
taking a few of my companions with me
The only animal we took was the donkey that I rode on

2:13: It was still night as I left the city through the Valley Gate on the west and went south past Dragon's Fountain to the Rubbish Gate
I inspected the broken walls of the city and the gates that had been destroyed by fire

2:14: Then on the east side of the city I went north to the Fountain Gate and the King's Pool
The donkey I was riding could not find any path through the rubble

2:15: so I went down into Kidron Valley and rode along
Then I returned the way I had come and went back into the city through the Valley Gate

2:16: None of the local officials knew where I had gone or what I had been doing
So far I had not said anything to any of the other Jews
or anyone else who would be taking part in the work

2:17: But now I said to them
See what trouble we are in because Jerusalem is in ruins and its gates are destroyed
Let's rebuild the city walls and put an end to our disgrace

2:18: And I told them how God had been with me and helped me
and what the emperor had said to me
And they got ready to start the work

2:19: and an Arab named Geshem heard what we were planning to do
they laughed at us and said
What do you think you're doing
Are you going to rebel against the emperor

2:20: The God of Heaven will give us success
and we are going to start building
But you have no right to any property in Jerusalem
and you have no share in its traditions

3:1: This is how the city wall was rebuilt
The High Priest Eliashib and his fellow priests rebuilt the Sheep Gate
and put the gates in place
They dedicated the wall as far as the Tower of the Hundred and the Tower of Hananel

3:2: The men of Jericho built the next section
Zaccur son of Imri built the next section

3:3: The clan of Hassenaah built the Fish Gate
They put the beams and the gates in place
and put in the bolts and bars for locking the gate

3:4: the son of Uriah and grandson of Hakkoz
the son of Berechiah and grandson of Meshezabel
Zadok son of Baana built the next section

3:5: The men of Tekoa built the next section
but the leading men of the town refused to do the manual labor assigned them by the supervisors

3:6: Joiada son of Paseah and Meshullam son of Besodeiah rebuilt Jeshanah Gate
They put the beams and the gates in place
and put in the bolts and bars for locking the gate

3:7: and the men of Gibeon and Mizpah built the next section
as far as the residence of the governor of West-of-Euphrates

3:9: ruler of half of the Jerusalem District

3:10: Jedaiah son of Harumaph built the next section
which was near his own house
Hattush son of Hashabneiah built the next section

3:11: Malchijah son of Harim and Hasshub son of Pahath Moab built both the next section and the Tower of the Ovens

3:12: ruler of the other half of the Jerusalem District
His daughters helped with the work

3:13: Hanun and the inhabitants of the city of Zanoah rebuilt the Valley Gate
They put the gates in place
put in the bolts and the bars for locking the gate
and repaired the wall for fifteen hundred feet
as far as the Rubbish Gate

3:14: ruler of the Beth Haccherem District
He put the gates in place
and put in the bolts and the bars for locking the gate

3:15: and put in the bolts and the bars
At the Pool of Shelah he built the wall next to the royal garden
as far as the stairs leading down from David's City

3:16: ruler of half of the Bethzur District

3:17: The following Levites rebuilt the next several sections of the wall
Rehum son of Bani built the next section
ruler of half of the Keilah District
built the next section on behalf of his district

3:18: ruler of the other half of the Keilah District

3:19: built the next section in front of the armory
as far as the place where the wall turns

3:20: Baruch son of Zabbai built the next section
as far as the entrance to the house of the High Priest Eliashib

3:21: the son of Uriah and grandson of Hakkoz
up to the far end of Eliashib's house

3:22: The following priests rebuilt the next several sections of the wall
Priests from the area around Jerusalem built the next section

3:23: Benjamin and Hasshub built the next section
which was in front of their houses
the son of Maaseiah and grandson of Ananiah
which was in front of his house

3:24: Binnui son of Henadad built the next section
from Azariah's house to the corner of the wall

3:25: Palal son of Uzai built the next section
beginning at the corner of the wall and the tower of the upper palace near the court of the guard
Pedaiah son of Parosh built the next section
to a point on the east near the Water Gate and the tower guarding the Temple
This was near that part of the city called Ophel

3:26: Palal son of Uzai built the next section
beginning at the corner of the wall and the tower of the upper palace near the court of the guard
Pedaiah son of Parosh built the next section
to a point on the east near the Water Gate and the tower guarding the Temple
This was near that part of the city called Ophel

3:27: The men of Tekoa built the next section
from a point opposite the large tower guarding the Temple as far as the wall near Ophel

3:28: A group of priests built the next section
going north from the Horse Gate
each one building in front of his own house

3:29: Zadok son of Immer built the next section
which was in front of his house

3:30: Hananiah son of Shelemiah and Hanun
Meshullam son of Berechiah built the next section
which was in front of his house

3:31: as far as the building used by the Temple workers and the merchants
which was by the Miphkad Gate to the Temple
near the room on top of the northeast corner of the wall

3:32: The goldsmiths and the merchants built the last section
from the room at the corner as far as the Sheep Gate

4:1: When Sanballat heard that we Jews had begun rebuilding the wall
he became furious and began to ridicule us

4:2: In front of his companions and the Samaritan troops he said
What do these miserable Jews think they're doing
Do they intend to rebuild the city
Do they think that by offering sacrifices they can finish the work in one day
Can they make building stones out of heaps of burnt rubble

4:3: Tobiah was standing there beside him
What kind of wall could they ever build
Even a fox could knock it down

4:4: Hear how they make fun of us
Let their ridicule fall on their own heads
Let them be robbed of everything they have
and let them be taken as prisoners to a foreign land

4:5: Don't forgive the evil they do and don't forget their sins
for they have insulted us who are building

4:6: So we went on rebuilding the wall
and soon it was half its full height
because the people were eager to work

4:7: and Ashdod heard that we were making progress in rebuilding the wall of Jerusalem and that the gaps in the wall were being closed

4:8: So they all plotted together to come and attack Jerusalem and create confusion

4:9: but we prayed to our God and kept men on guard against them day and night

4:10: The people of Judah had a song they sang
There's so much rubble to take away
How can we build the wall today

4:11: Our enemies thought we would not see them or know what was happening until they were already upon us
killing us and putting an end to our work

4:12: But time after time Jews who were living among our enemies came to warn us of the plans our enemies were making against us

4:13: So I armed the people with swords
and stationed them by clans behind the wall

4:14: I saw that the people were worried
so I said to them and to their leaders and officials
Don't be afraid of our enemies
Remember how great and terrifying the Lord is

4:15: Our enemies heard that we had found out what they were plotting
and they realized that God had defeated their plans
Then all of us went back to rebuilding the wall

4:16: From then on half of my men worked and half stood guard
wearing coats of armor and armed with spears
And our leaders gave their full support to the people

4:17: Even those who carried building materials worked with one hand and kept a weapon in the other

4:18: and everyone who was building kept a sword strapped to their waist
The man who was to sound the alarm on the bugle stayed with me

4:19: I told the people and their officials and leaders
The work is spread out over such a distance that we are widely separated from one another on the wall

4:20: Our God will fight for us

4:21: from dawn until the stars came out at night
half of us worked on the wall
while the other half stood guard with spears

4:22: During this time I told the men in charge that they and all their helpers had to stay in Jerusalem at night
so that we could guard the city at night as well as work in the daytime

4:23: I didn't take off my clothes even at night
neither did any of my companions nor my servants nor my bodyguards
And we all kept our weapons at hand

5:1: Some time later many of the people
began to complain against the other Jews

5:2: we need grain to keep us alive

5:3: We have had to mortgage our fields and vineyards and houses to get enough grain to keep us from starving

5:4: We had to borrow money to pay the royal tax on our fields and vineyards

5:5: We are of the same race as the other Jews
Aren't our children just as good as theirs
But we have to make slaves of our children
Some of our daughters have already been sold as slaves
We are helpless because our fields and vineyards have been taken away from us

5:7: I denounced the leaders and officials of the people and told them
You are oppressing your own relatives
I called a public assembly to deal with the problem

5:8: As far as we have been able
we have been buying back our Jewish relatives who had to sell themselves to foreigners
Now you are forcing your own relatives to sell themselves to you
The leaders were silent and could find nothing to say

5:9: What you are doing is wrong
You ought to obey God and do what's right
Then you would not give our enemies

5:10: I have let the people borrow money and grain from me
and so have my companions and those who work for me
Now let's give up all our claims to repayment

5:11: Cancel all the debts they owe you
money or grain or wine or olive oil
And give them back their fields

5:12: We'll give the property back and not try to collect the debts
I called in the priests and made the leaders swear in front of them to keep the promise they had just made

5:13: Then I took off the sash I was wearing around my waist and shook it out
This is how God will shake any of you who don't keep your promise
God will take away your houses and everything you own
and will leave you with nothing
And the leaders kept their promise

5:14: During all the twelve years that I was governor of the land of Judah
from the twentieth year that Artaxerxes was emperor until his thirty-second year
neither my relatives nor I ate the food I was entitled to have as governor

5:15: Every governor who had been in office before me had been a burden to the people and had demanded forty silver coins a day for food and wine
Even their servants had oppressed the people

5:16: I put all my energy into rebuilding the wall and did not acquire any property
Everyone who worked for me joined in the rebuilding

5:17: I regularly fed at my table a hundred and fifty of the Jewish people and their leaders
besides all the people who came to me from the surrounding nations

5:18: Every day I served one beef
and every ten days I provided a fresh supply of wine
But I knew what heavy burdens the people had to bear
and so I did not claim the allowance that the governor is entitled to

5:19: remember to my credit everything that I have done for this people

6:1: and the rest of our enemies heard that we had finished building the wall and that there were no gaps left in it
although we still had not set up the gates in the gateways

6:2: So Sanballat and Geshem sent me a message
suggesting that I meet with them in one of the villages in the Plain of Ono
This was a trick of theirs to try to harm me

6:3: I sent messengers to say to them
I am doing important work and can't go down there
I am not going to let the work stop just to go and see you

6:4: They sent me the same message four times
and each time I sent them the same reply

6:5: Then Sanballat sent one of his servants to me with a fifth message
this one in the form of an unsealed letter

6:6: Geshem tells me that a rumor is going around among the neighboring peoples that you and the Jewish people intend to revolt and that this is why you are rebuilding the wall
He also says you plan to make yourself king

6:7: and that you have arranged for some prophets to proclaim in Jerusalem that you are the king of Judah
His Majesty is certain to hear about this
so I suggest that you and I meet to talk the situation over

6:8: I sent a reply to him
Nothing of what you are saying is true
You have made it all up yourself

6:9: They were trying to frighten us into stopping work

6:10: About this time I went to visit Shemaiah
the son of Delaiah and grandson of Mehetabel
who was unable to leave his house
You and I must go and hide together in the Holy Place of the Temple and lock the doors
because they are coming to kill you
Any night now they will come to kill you

6:11: I'm not the kind of person that runs and hides
Do you think I would try to save my life by hiding in the Temple

6:12: I realized that God had not spoken to Shemaiah
but that Tobiah and Sanballat had bribed him to give me this warning

6:13: They hired him to frighten me into sinning
so that they could ruin my reputation and humiliate me

6:14: remember what Tobiah and Sanballat have done and punish them
Remember that woman Noadiah and all the other prophets who tried to frighten me

6:15: After fifty-two days of work the entire wall was finished on the twenty-fifth day of the month of Elul

6:16: When our enemies in the surrounding nations heard this
they realized that they had lost face
since everyone knew that the work had been done with God's help

6:17: During all this time the Jewish leaders had been in correspondence with Tobiah

6:18: Many people in Judah were on his side because of his Jewish father-in-law
his son Jehohanan had married the daughter of Meshullam son of Berechiah

6:19: People would talk in front of me about all the good deeds Tobiah had done and would tell him everything I said
And he kept sending me letters to try to frighten me

7:1: And now the wall had been rebuilt
the gates had all been put in place
the members of the sacred choir
and the other Levites had been assigned their work

7:2: I put two men in charge of governing the city of Jerusalem
Hananiah was a reliable and God-fearing man without equal

7:3: I told them not to have the gates of Jerusalem opened in the morning until well after sunrise and to have them closed and barred before the guards went off duty at sunset
I also told them to appoint guards from among the people who lived in Jerusalem and to assign some of them to specific posts and others to patrol the area around their own houses

7:4: but not many people were living in it
and not many houses had been built yet

7:5: God inspired me to assemble the people and their leaders and officials and to check their family records
I located the records of those who had first returned from captivity
and this is the information I found

7:6: Many of the exiles left the province of Babylon and returned to Jerusalem and Judah
Their families had been living in exile in Babylonia ever since King Nebuchadnezzar had taken them there as prisoners

8:1: By the seventh month the people of Israel were all settled in their towns
On the first day of that month they all assembled in Jerusalem
in the square just inside the Water Gate
the priest and scholar of the Law which the Lord had given Israel through Moses
to get the book of the Law

8:2: So Ezra brought it to the place where the people had gathered
and the children who were old enough to understand

8:3: There in the square by the gate he read the Law to them from dawn until noon

8:4: Ezra was standing on a wooden platform that had been built for the occasion
The following men stood at his right
and the following stood at his left

8:5: As Ezra stood there on the platform high above the people
they all kept their eyes fixed on him
As soon as he opened the book

8:6: All the people raised their arms in the air and answered
with their faces to the ground

8:7: Then they rose and stood in their places
and the following Levites explained the Law to them

8:8: They gave an oral translation of God's Law and explained it so that the people could understand it

8:9: When the people heard what the Law required
they were so moved that they began to cry
the priest and scholar of the Law
and the Levites who were explaining the Law told all the people
This day is holy to the Lord your God
so you are not to mourn or cry

8:10: Now go home and have a feast
Share your food and wine with those who don't have enough
Today is holy to our Lord
The joy that the Lord gives you will make you strong

8:11: The Levites went around calming the people and telling them not to be sad on such a holy day

8:12: So all the people went home and ate and drank joyfully and shared what they had with others
because they understood what had been read to them

8:13: The next day the heads of the clans
together with the priests and the Levites
went to Ezra to study the teachings of the Law

8:14: which the Lord gave through Moses

8:15: So they gave the following instructions and sent them all through Jerusalem and the other cities and towns
Go out to the hills and get branches from pines

8:16: So the people got branches and built shelters on the flat roofs of their houses

9:1: On the twenty-fourth day of the same month the people of Israel gathered to fast in order to show sorrow for their sins
They had already separated themselves from all foreigners
They wore sackcloth and put dust on their heads as signs of grief
Then they stood and began to confess the sins that they and their ancestors had committed

9:2: On the twenty-fourth day of the same month the people of Israel gathered to fast in order to show sorrow for their sins
They had already separated themselves from all foreigners
They wore sackcloth and put dust on their heads as signs of grief
Then they stood and began to confess the sins that they and their ancestors had committed

9:3: For about three hours the Law of the Lord their God was read to them
and for the next three hours they confessed their sins and worshiped the Lord their God

9:4: There was a platform for the Levites
They prayed aloud to the Lord their God

9:5: The following Levites gave a call to worship
Stand up and praise the Lord your God
Let everyone praise his glorious name
although no human praise is great enough

9:6: And then the people of Israel prayed this prayer
you made the heavens and the stars of the sky
You made land and sea and everything in them
The heavenly powers bow down and worship you

9:7: chose Abram and led him out of Ur in Babylonia
you changed his name to Abraham

9:8: You found that he was faithful to you
and you made a covenant with him
You promised to give him the land of the Canaanites
the land of the Hittites and the Amorites
to be a land where his descendants would live

9:9: You saw how our ancestors suffered in Egypt
you heard their call for help at the Red Sea

9:10: You worked amazing miracles against the king
against his officials and the people of his land
because you knew how they oppressed your people
You won then the fame you still have today

9:11: Through the sea you made a path for your people and led them through on dry ground
Those who pursued them drowned in deep water
as a stone sinks in the raging sea

9:12: With a cloud you led them in daytime
and at night you lighted their way with fire

9:13: At Mount Sinai you came down from heaven
you spoke to your people and gave them good laws and sound teachings

9:14: You taught them to keep your Sabbaths holy
and through your servant Moses you gave them your laws

9:15: you gave them bread from heaven
and water from a rock when they were thirsty
You told them to take control of the land which you had promised to give them

9:16: But our ancestors grew proud and stubborn and refused to obey your commands

9:17: they forgot the miracles you had performed
In their pride they chose a leader to take them back to slavery in Egypt
But you are a God who forgives

9:18: They made an idol in the shape of a bull-calf and said it was the god who led them from Egypt

9:19: But you did not abandon them there in the desert
You did not take away the cloud or the fire that showed them the path by day and night

9:20: In your goodness you told them what they should do
you fed them manna and gave them water to drink

9:21: Through forty years in the desert you provided all that they needed
and their feet were not swollen with pain

9:22: You let them conquer nations and kingdoms
They conquered the land of Heshbon

9:23: You gave them as many children as there are stars in the sky
and let them conquer and live in the land that you had promised their ancestors to give them

9:24: They conquered the land of Canaan
you overcame the people living there
You gave your people the power to do as they pleased with the people and kings of Canaan

9:25: They ate all they wanted and grew fat
they enjoyed all the good things you gave them

9:26: But your people rebelled and disobeyed you
they turned their backs on your Law
They killed the prophets who warned them
who told them to turn back to you
They insulted you time after time

9:27: so you let their enemies conquer and rule them
In their trouble they called to you for help
and you answered them from heaven
In your great mercy you sent them leaders who rescued them from their foes

9:28: and again you let their enemies conquer them
Yet when they repented and asked you to save them
and time after time you rescued them in your great mercy

9:29: You warned them to obey your teachings
but in pride they rejected your laws
although keeping your Law is the way to life

9:30: Year after year you patiently warned them
You inspired your prophets to speak
so you let them be conquered by other nations

9:31: you did not forsake or destroy them
You are a gracious and merciful God

9:32: You faithfully keep your covenant promises
From the time when Assyrian kings oppressed us
and all our people have suffered
Remember how much we have suffered

9:33: You have done right to punish us

9:34: and priests have not kept your Law
They did not listen to your commands and warnings

9:35: kings ruled your people when they lived in the broad
but they failed to turn from sin and serve you

9:36: And now we are slaves in the land that you gave us
this fertile land which gives us food

9:37: What the land produces goes to the kings that you put over us because we sinned
They do as they please with us and our livestock
and we are in deep distress

9:38: Because of all that has happened
hereby make a solemn written agreement
and our priests put their seals to it

10:30: We will not intermarry with the foreigners living in our land
